N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1932.4 - Defaults on mortgages not made by the corporation

State Regulations

In cases of projects subject to mortgages made by any
lender, except as to loans made by the corporation: (a) the lender must give notice to the
corporation of any default in payment of principal or interest on such mortgage
by the owner; (b) the corporation
shall have 60 days upon receipt of such notice to assist the owner in curing
the default; and
(c) the provisions
of this section shall be made part of the regulatory agreement or other
instrument. Notes
